author: nflaig
content:
On the topic of removal of apis, I was wondering if it makes sense to remove the v1 attestation apis already for electra since they become effectively unusable afterwards because those only support phase0 format.

The v2 apis are fork-aware and backward compatible and can be used even before the hard fork.

author: nflaig
content: also related, what's the strategy client use right now to switch to v2, we just do it based on clock slot to be sure the beacon node supports the apis

author: tersec
content: yes, clock slot for Nimbus also

author: jgm
content:
A question on the `/eth/v2/beacon/pool/attestations`: the current spec gives no details about the eligibility of sending either the phase0 Attestation or the Electra SingleAttestation, so do client teams:

1) accept only Attestation before the Electra hard fork, and only SingleAttestation after?
2) accept either Attestation or SingleAttestation both before and after the Electra hard fork?
3) something else?

author: nflaig
content: we kinda have the same assumptions as in the block apis, maybe we should have a explicit note for this

author: nflaig
content: 1) is the only option that works since `Attestation` is the phase0 format and `SingleAttestation` is a new format introduced in electra

author: nflaig
content: looks like there is no note in https://github.com/ethereum/beacon-APIs/blob/master/apis/beacon/blocks/blocks.v2.yaml either, I wonder if it makes sense to move the phase0 specific types into the phase0 folder and namespace
